mlive.com  (WEB - en-US)

An umbrella site representing eight newspapers covering local news around Michigan, including the Flint, Ann Arbor, and Grand Rapids areas.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

Mlive.com is owned by a subsidiary of privately held Advance Publications Inc., which owns the Conde Nast publishing empire and newspapers in more than two dozen U.S. markets. The site is supported by advertising and subscriptions.

Content

The site reports news in about 10 Michigan metropolitan areas and statewide. Readers can select news and weather from any of the areas or the entire state. A database provides public information from across the state, such as community data, crime, divorce records and government salaries.

“Michigan’s Best” offers lifestyle news on food, community events and concert venues. National and world coverage is relatively limited by comparison to other metropolitan news outlets.

Credibility

Local and regional stories are reported with attributed sources and direct quotes. Opinion columns and editorials are labeled. Headlines accurately describe story content. No corrections policy is provided nor were any corrections found on the site. Three NewsGuard emails to Mlive.com’s reporters and editors asking about the site’s corrections practices went unanswered.

Transparency

The site’s articles list the author’s names, email addresses, and sometimes their phone numbers and social media contacts. The site provides names and photos for business and editorial leadership.

Links to the regional newsrooms are provided.  Advertising and sponsored content is distinguishable from editorial content.

History

The current structure of MLive and Advance was formed in 2011 and encompassed the former Booth Newspapers, to create a “digital-first company.” The mlive.com domain was registered in 1996.
